parse.title: List of Chinese administrative divisions by population

text.*:
For the administrative divisions governed by the Republic of China, see List of administrative divisions of Taiwan.
PRC-controlled administrative divisions by population (2013).
First or provincial level Administrative divisions
of China by:
  • Area
  • Population
  • Population density
  • GDP
  • GDP per capita
  • Female infanticide
  • Sex ratio
  • Disposable income per capita
  • HDI
  • Highest point
  • Natural growth rate
  • Life expectancy
  • Illiteracy rate
  • Tax Revenues
  • Historical capitals
  • v
  • t
  • e

This is a list of the first-level administrative divisions of China in order of their total resident populations. It includes all provinces, autonomous regions, direct-controlled municipalities and special administrative regions.

Contents

  • 1 List
  • 2 See also
  • 3 References
    • 3.1 Footnotes
    • 3.2 Sources

References[edit]

Footnotes[edit]

  1. ^ a b Hainan Province was part of Guangdong Province until 1988
  2. ^ a b Guangzhou was separate from Guangdong Province from 1947-1954
  3. ^ a b Qingdao part of Shandong Province until 1929; dissolved in 1949 and incorporated into Shandong
  4. ^ a b Weihai also known as Weihaiwei. Established in 1930; dissolved in 1945 and incorporated into Shandong
  5. ^ a b Chongqing was part of Sichuan Province until 1939 and 1954 to 1997
  6. ^ a b Shanghai was part of Jiangsu Province until 1927
  7. ^ a b Nanjing part of Jiangsu Province until 1927; dissolved in 1952 and incorporated into Jiangsu
  8. ^ Hebei was known as Zhili until 1928
  9. ^ a b Beijing was part of Hebei Province until 1928
  10. ^ a b Tainjin was part of Hebei Province until 1928 and 1954 to 1967
  11. ^ a b Wuhan (Hankou) part of Hubei Province until 1927; dissolved in 1949 and incorporated into Hubei
  12. ^ a b c d e Autonomous Region
  13. ^ Liaoning was known as Fengtian until 1929
  14. ^ a b Shenyang part of Liaoning Province until 1947; dissolved in 1954 and incorporated into Liaoning
  15. ^ a b Dalian part of Liaoning Province until 1947; dissolved in 1954 and incorporated into Liaoning
  16. ^ a b Established in 1923; dissolved in 1932 and incorporated into Manchukuo / Heilongjiang (present)
  17. ^ a b Harbin part of Heilongjiang Province until 1947-1949 and 1953-1954
  18. ^ a b Xi'an part of Shaanxi Province until 1947; dissolved in 1954 and incorporated into Shaanxi
  19. ^ a b c d e f g h i j k Direct-controlled municipality
  20. ^ a b Ningxia was part of Gansu until 1929 and 1954-1958
  21. ^ Beijing was known as Beiping in 1928 until 1949
  22. ^ a b Special Administrative Region
  23. ^ Incorporated into a province in 1928; dissolved in 1955 and incorporated into Hebei, Liaoning, & Inner Mongolia
  24. ^ Incorporated into a province in 1939; dissolved in 1955 and incorporated into Sichuan and Tibet
  25. ^ Incorporated into a province in 1928; dissolved in 1952 and incorporated into Inner Mongolia, Beijing & Hebei
  26. ^ Incorporated into a province in 1928; dissolved in 1954 and incorporated into Inner Mongolia
  27. ^ Xi'an fail to split from Shannxi in 1933; Xi'an was known as Xijing in 1933 until 1943
  28. ^ Liaodong was known as Andong in 1947 until 1949
  29. ^ Split from Liaoning Province in 1947; dissolved in 1954 and incorporated into Liaoning
  30. ^ Split from Liaoning Province in 1947; dissolved in 1949 and incorporated into Inner Mongolia and Liaoning
  31. ^ Split from Jilin Province in 1947; dissolved in 1955 and incorporated into Heilongjiang
  32. ^ Split from Jilin Province in 1947; dissolved in 1949 and incorporated into Songjiang
  33. ^ Split from Heilongjiang Province in 1947; dissolved in 1949 and incorporated into Heilongjiang
  34. ^ Split from Heilongjiang Province in 1947; dissolved in 1949 and incorporated into Inner Mongolia
  35. ^ Part of Wuhan was known as Hankou
  36. ^ Dalian was known as Lüda (Lyuda) in 1950 until 1954
  37. ^ Claimed by the PRC
  38. ^ Declared independent in 1911 and claimed by the ROC until 2012[citation needed]

Sources[edit]

  2. ^ "CIA World Factbook 2010".

  4. ^ "中华人民共和国国家统计局关于一九九〇年人口普查主要数据的公报". National Bureau of Statistics of China. Archived from the original on 2012-06-19. 
  5. ^ "中华人民共和国国家统计局关于一九八二年人口普查主要数字的公报". National Bureau of Statistics of China. Archived from the original on 2012-05-10. 
  6. ^ "第二次全国人口普查结果的几项主要统计数字". National Bureau of Statistics of China. Archived from the original on 2012-09-14. 
  7. ^ "中华人民共和国国家统计局关于第一次全国人口调查登记结果的公报". National Bureau of Statistics of China. Archived from the original on 2009-08-05.

  9. ^ "1936-37年中国人口". Retrieved 6 March 2014.
